comments.body:
1. does this need a license comment?
2. I'd prefer a link to a doc in the cocoon source tree (or anywhere, as long as there is only one). this schema is bound to change :)

1. I looked at cirrus and devicelab yaml files and didn't see license headers, so I didn't include one here
2. That's a good point (make it easier to copy this config to other repos). For now, is it okay to leave this in and later this week I can add documentation in Cocoon on the configs?

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +-1,3 @@# Describes the targets run in continuous integration environment.
#
# Cocoon[1] uses this file to generate a checklist of tasks to be performed for

comments.body: How will this work for builders that run only on a subset of branches?

I need to sync up with @christopherfujino on this more, but we may need to duplicate the enabled_branches property into the target so it can override what it runs on. As we look into. bringing up the scheduler for that use case we can revisit
We decided there will be these global values, but targets will be able to override what is globally set

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +22,26 @@# * properties: Map<String, String> of properties to pass to recipe
enabled_branches:
  - master
targets:
  - name: analyze_linux

comments.body: What does bringup mean? Does it mean something different from, or in addition to, flaky?
See go/flutter-build-test-infra for the full discussion, but we migrated to `bringup` as we don't want to encourage having flaky tests
I don't see a discussion of "bringup" vs. "flaky" in go/flutter-build-test-infra. Did that discussion take place somewhere else?

Internal link to the comment: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1xXTh1B0xXsxXKXdVGY4MqajEym11j01Dj9RxZlK333o/edit?resourcekey=0-lSU3Yr5lwwuDn8dw2fWzeA&disco=AAAAHzn0jew

> The only "real" use case for this is whether or not this is a new enough test that we don't want it to red the build if it goes wrong, to make debugging/fixing it easier initially.
An established builder should ordinarily not get marked flaky.

We discussed this in the Flutter design review, but I did not capture the notes

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1384,1388 @@  - name: mac_ios_native_ui_tests_ios32
    builder: Mac_ios native_ui_tests_ios32
    bringup: true
    presubmit: false
    scheduler: luci
